ai-tha-ap309:1.1_0: “There is no need for the Fortunate One,
ai-tha-ap309:1.3_0: When it comes to the trees
ai-tha-ap309:1.4_0: those who go away, and are departed,
ai-tha-ap309:3.1_0: My mind is serene with a thought
ai-tha-ap309:3.2_0: I am a flower in fruit,
ai-tha-ap309:4.4_0: rebirth is a fruition for me;
ai-tha-ap309:5.1_0: if he makes his four eons;
ai-tha-ap309:5.2_0: of which the gods from who delighted
ai-tha-ap309:5.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap309:5.4_0: this is the fruit of monastery.
ai-tha-ap309:8.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Rāma.
